chargeHist.descr: Sexual Assault of a Child Under 16 Years of Age

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Motion Hearing, 09/28/2022

3:14 PM case called. Attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Bradley D Loew in court with Attorney Ryan J. Moertel. State in compliance with victim notification requirements.

Attorney Moertel summarizes motion filed to dismiss count 2. State makes argument to Defense's motion and requests that the motion be denied. Defense makes argument.

Court denies Motion to Dismiss.

Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on December 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
